conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Container A is positioned at the top left of the image, container B is in the middle, and container C is at the top right.
Liquid flows diagonally downward from containers A, B, and C towards the bottom of the image.
Baffle D is positioned on the left side at the bottom, and baffle E is positioned on the right side at the bottom.
Stream A hits the blue baffle and is deflected to the left.
Stream B falls on the black baffle and is deflected to the right.
Stream C falls straight down without meeting any obstacles.

premise: Stream A hits the blue baffle and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Liquid from container A flows into container D.

premise: Stream B falls on the black baffle and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from container B flows into container E.

premise: Stream C falls straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Liquid from container C flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from container A flows into container D; liquid from container B flows into container E; liquid from container C flows into container E.
conclusion: All liquid from A ends up in container D; liquid from B and C ends in container E.
